articles.content: Much has changed since the first American spaceflight in 1961: NASA has explored new places with new programs, new people, and new technologies. Yet some of the language popularly used to describe th… [+4455 chars]
articles.description: Some of the language once used in the early days of human spaceflight has not kept pace with the evolution of America’s space program. We now use "crewed" or "piloted" instead of "manned," for example. The era of “manned” spaceflight ended long ago, and the c…
articles.title: A Seat in the Cockpit: Recognizing and Replacing Biases with Gender Inclusive Language - National Air and Space Museum
